Key Match Events: Germany were held to a 0-0 draw by Ukraine at the Max-Morlock stadium in Nuremberg.
Germany dominated long periods and created many chances but failed to make the breakthrough against a resilient Ukraine.
Germany's best first half chance fell to Ilkay Guendogan, who mistimed his jump as he attempted to meet a teasing cross by Pascal Gross.
The closest Germany came was on the hour, when Maximilian Beier rattled the inside of the post with a first-time shot from Robert Andrich's perfect through ball.
Anatolii Trubin, Ukraine's goalkeeper, made a string of top saves to keep Germany at bay.
Pre-Game Insights: More than 44,000 fans were in jovial mood at kick-off, expecting a Germany that have rediscovered their form under Julian Nagelsmann to put on a show.
Germany came into this game having turned a corner under Nagelsmann, winning their last two games against France and the Netherlands with an aggressive, high tempo style.
Nagelsmann was without Real Madrid's Toni Kroos and Antonio Ruediger, both rested after winning the Champions League final, as well as Borussia Dortmund pair Nico Schlotterbeck and Niclas Fuellkrug.
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann expressed that the team wanted to win and played very well for long stretches.
Nagelsmann highlighted the need for the team to be more aggressive and get more players into the box.
Thomas Mueller praised the impact of Maximilian Beier, noting that he deserved a goal for his efforts.
Nagelsmann reflected on the performances of Pascal Gross, Robert Andrich, and the impact of substitutes like Beier and Deniz Undav.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a friendly football match held in Nuremberg, eastern Germany, on June 3, 2024.
The Ukrainians, who qualified for their fourth straight Euro with a play-off victory over Iceland in March, will be buoyed by denying the tournament hosts on home soil.
